thread.title: Vigil to be held to remember Harry Sievey, son of Frank Sidebottom creator, who has died
thread.title_full: Vigil to be held to remember Harry Sievey, son of Frank Sidebottom creator, who has died

author: Andrew Bardsley
title: Vigil to be held to remember Harry Sievey, son of Frank Sidebottom creator, who has died
text:
Vigil to be held to remember Harry Sievey, son of Frank Sidebottom creator, who has died People are being invited to the event at Withington library on Monday Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A vigil will be held to remember the son of Frank Sidebottom creator Chris Sievey who died while riding his bike in Withington. 
Harry Sievey, 24, died on February 12 after his bicycle was involved in a crash with another biker and a blue Vaxuhall Corsa. 
People are being invited to gather at Withington library on Monday at 6pm. 
During the ceremony, a ‘ghost bike’ will be unveiled in Harry’s memory. 
Campaigners will also use the event to call on the authorities to do more to ensure the safety of cyclists on our roads. 
On the event’s Facebook page, organisers said: “Harry Sievey was taken far too soon, on the evening of Sunday 12th February 2017, aged just 24. 
“He had been cycling on Mauldeth Road West in Withington, Manchester, and was pronounced dead at the scene, having been involved in a collision with a car. 
“A vigil will be held on Monday 20th February and a ghost bike will be installed in his memory. Read More Harry Sievey's family pay tribute to 'happy-go-lucky' son and brother 
“People are invited to assemble by Withington Library from 6:00pm for a 6:15pm start. We expect the event to conclude by 7pm. 
“We welcome everyone – whether cyclist, pedestrian, motorist or a multimodal traveller – to join us at the vigil to remember Harry Sievey and make a stand for safer roads, investment in cycling facilities, and cleaner air. 
“Please share the event and spread the word to anyone who may be interested.” 
Harry’s death comes after his father Chris passed away in 2010 after a cancer battle. 
A bronze statue of his famous Frank Sidebottom character now stands in Timperley village in his memory. 
In tribute to Harry, his family said: “There are no words for another tragic and sad loss to our family. 
“Our little brother and loving son Harry was always happy-go-lucky. We are heart broken, taken from us before his time. “ 
They added: “We ask for our privacy at this time why we come to terms with our loss.” 
Following Harry’s death, police launched an investigation. 
A 61-year-old man has since been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. Like us on Facebook
